cases.input: Patient says they don't feel well. That's all they will say.
cases.notes: System should flag low confidence and missing information

cases.input: 45-year-old male. Denies chest pain, denies shortness of breath, denies fever, denies nausea. Reports mild headache for 2 days. No medication use. No allergies.
cases.notes: System must correctly identify negations and not flag denied symptoms as red flags

cases.input: 68-year-old male with sudden onset chest pain AND sudden right-sided weakness AND difficulty speaking, started 20 minutes ago. History of CAD and prior stroke. On warfarin.
cases.notes: Multiple simultaneous red flag categories – should escalate to maximum

cases.input: 8-month-old infant, parents report decreased feeding for 2 days and increased sleepiness. Mild fever 37.8°C. No rash. No vomiting. Fontanelle appears normal.
cases.notes: Pediatric cases should be triaged more conservatively

cases.input: 50-year-old female reports severe 10/10 abdominal pain but appears comfortable, vitals completely normal, laughing with family. Pain started 1 week ago. No weight loss. Normal appetite.
cases.notes: System should note discrepancy between reported severity and clinical presentation
